page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: Of the 3 farms studied none are general farms.Farm 1.is run by a farmer & his son.The farmer lives in the old house & the son in a modern bungalow.The farm is a pig farm with over a 1OOO pigs weaned in the first six mths.of the yr.The pigs are housed in sweat boxes with strict controls to prevent disease spreading.They grow barley for pig fodder. Farm 2.is a dairy farm of 15O acres.The house is old but with modern additions.There are 13O cattle in the milking herd.The cows graze but in winter are fed silage & cattle cake.Due to milk quotas foreign bulls are being introduced & the emphasis has shifted to beef production.Farm 3.is a mushroom farm.The farm house is modern but the farm is very old,the farmer lived formerly in an Elizabethan building which is called Lees Hall.
